questions.q: How can I get a PESEL number?
questions.a: You can obtain a PESEL number by applying in person at the Płock City Hall (Urząd Miasta Płocka) with your passport or residence permit.

questions.q: What documents are required for a residence permit?
questions.a: You need an application form, biometric photo, rental agreement, proof of financial stability, and health insurance.

questions.q: How can I register for free medical assistance?
questions.a: You can register through the National Health Fund (NFZ) office in Płock to access public healthcare services.

questions.q: Are there social support programs for immigrants?
questions.a: Yes, the Płock City Council and NGOs offer several assistance programs for immigrants and refugees.

questions.q: How can I get a public transport card in Płock?
questions.a: You can obtain the Płock City Card (Karta Miejska) at ticket offices, selected kiosks, or online through the municipal website.

questions.q: Which mobile apps can I use for transport?
questions.a: You can use JakDojade, Koleo, and local ZTM Płock apps to plan routes and purchase tickets.
